conclusion: The problem involves calculating the length of the arc where light emitted from a point source at O cannot directly exit through the sides AB or BC of the square ABCO.
The given parameters are: radius of arc AC, R; refractive index of the material, n = 2; and square ABCO has side length 2R.
The diagram shows a square ABCO with a circular arc AC of radius R, centered at O. The point source of light is located at O.
The critical angle of the material is C, where sin(C) = 1/n = 1/2, so C = 30°.
A light ray along the direction DB just undergoes total internal reflection on the AB side if ∠ADF = 30°.
A light ray along the direction DG just undergoes total internal reflection on the BC side if ∠CDG = 30°.
The length of the arc FH can be calculated using the geometric relationship: FH = (1/12) × 2πR.
The length of the arc FH is FH = (1/6)πR.
